commit_message:
Add 169.254.169.254 when enable force_metadata

When enable force_metadata in dhcp.ini, and create a network
and a subnet, none 169.254.169.254/24 ip info set in related
namespace(qdhcp-XXX) with `ip a` command. In this case, vms could
not get metadata any more.

Change-Id: Ib5b95f3afc6e66f66cdb7e1e98e5450a6e80a1b2
Closes-Bug: #1549793

subject: Include query string in request logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 19:41:45.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/session.py'], 'message': "Include query string in request logging

While debugging openstacksdk, I noticed that the way we send query
parameters in a request led to them not being included in the URL that
gets logged within _http_log_request. When the `url` directly includes
the query string, it of course gets logged. When a caller utilizes the
`params` argument (set to a dictionary of query parameters), which is
subsequently handled inside of the requests library, those parameters
don't end up getting logged.

This change grabs any query parameters out of the `params` argument and
sends them into the log method. The resulting output of a url with
included query strings is wrapped in double quotes so the CURL command
that gets logged is actually runnable, because the question mark
separator is interpreted by the shell.

Change-Id: I249ae29e0d60887c637e497133c2a134f38982b5
"}]
commit_message:
Include query string in request logging

While debugging openstacksdk, I noticed that the way we send query
parameters in a request led to them not being included in the URL that
gets logged within _http_log_request. When the `url` directly includes
the query string, it of course gets logged. When a caller utilizes the
`params` argument (set to a dictionary of query parameters), which is
subsequently handled inside of the requests library, those parameters
don't end up getting logged.

This change grabs any query parameters out of the `params` argument and
sends them into the log method. The resulting output of a url with
included query strings is wrapped in double quotes so the CURL command
that gets logged is actually runnable, because the question mark
separator is interpreted by the shell.

Change-Id: I249ae29e0d60887c637e497133c2a134f38982b5

commit_message:
Make apt_fuel logging more obvious

Existing output was often mistaken for an error.
Fix with pushing warning instead of error messages when retries are not
run out of.

Change-Id: I0e7ed2c591297f44e6690d8c3a73625b151ad3cf
Closes-bug: #1567339
(cherry picked from commit b481d50509816134cc1aac7f512b0799f1a72f0b)

subject: Fix bug at creating subnet failed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-06 03:07:21.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/networks/subnets/workflows.py'], 'message': 'Fix bug at creating subnet failed

Failed to create subnet at admin dashboard. An error as follow raise:

   Error: Failed to create subnet "XX.XX.XX.XX/XX" for network "None":
   Invalid input for network_id. Reason: 'None' is not a valid UUID.

Specify `network` argument when call `_create_subnet` method to fix
this bug.

Change-Id: Ifa52fa88ebb60fabc6695f41095c254016aa36eb
Closes-bug: #1512669
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug at creating subnet failed

Failed to create subnet at admin dashboard. An error as follow raise:

   Error: Failed to create subnet "XX.XX.XX.XX/XX" for network "None":
   Invalid input for network_id. Reason: 'None' is not a valid UUID.

Specify `network` argument when call `_create_subnet` method to fix
this bug.

Change-Id: Ifa52fa88ebb60fabc6695f41095c254016aa36eb
Closes-bug: #1512669

We currently emit audit events when some resources are created,
deleted, or updated. We should do the same for when that action
fails.

subject: Use "visibility" param in create_image() for V1
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-14 14:41:58.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/wrappers/glance.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/wrappers/test_glance.py'], 'message': 'Use "visibility" param in create_image() for V1

The create_image() methods for V1 and V2 accept different params
(is_public and visibility accordingly) to make an image public or private.
This patch makes the create_image() method for V1 accept the "visibility"
param like it does the corresponding method for V2. Thus, it will allow us
to pass only one "visibility" parameter to the Glance wrapper.

Change-Id: Ic72fe2256573e31a80c2f245540ef57a05ae6eb2
'}]
commit_message:
Use "visibility" param in create_image() for V1

The create_image() methods for V1 and V2 accept different params
(is_public and visibility accordingly) to make an image public or private.
This patch makes the create_image() method for V1 accept the "visibility"
param like it does the corresponding method for V2. Thus, it will allow us
to pass only one "visibility" parameter to the Glance wrapper.

Change-Id: Ic72fe2256573e31a80c2f245540ef57a05ae6eb2

subject: Adds missing attribute from get_cpus_info query
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 14:48:30.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/hostutils.py'], 'message': 'Adds missing attribute from get_cpus_info query

There is a new field added in cpu_info called MaxClockSpeed.
The field is not included in the query so its value will not
be retrieved with the query and it will be always None.

This patch adds the missing field in the query in order
to retrieve its value.

Closes-Bug: #1570345

Change-Id: Ie6d531ccd9fdb74c700dc6f52674d46838f5ee1a
(cherry picked from commit c478d43a7f9122af1bd15c39419242861f8c6137)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds missing attribute from get_cpus_info query

There is a new field added in cpu_info called MaxClockSpeed.
The field is not included in the query so its value will not
be retrieved with the query and it will be always None.

This patch adds the missing field in the query in order
to retrieve its value.

Closes-Bug: #1570345

Change-Id: Ie6d531ccd9fdb74c700dc6f52674d46838f5ee1a
(cherry picked from commit c478d43a7f9122af1bd15c39419242861f8c6137)

commit_message:
Add a fork for Ironic vender driver

Add a fork when valuing DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER in setup_localrc
function, so that vender can enable its own driver, and write it
into IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS of localrc, in a gate JOB.

Change-Id: Id3e7384a6dc76a5b6f4382b279c58496444c6da9
Closes-Bug: 1561296

subject: Let BUILD_TIMEOUT in Ironic local.conf configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 01:11:37.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Let BUILD_TIMEOUT in Ironic local.conf configurable

Before this fix:
BUILD_TIMEOUT is strict to 600 minutes
After this fix:
When BUILD_TIMEOUT has already been configured in environment
variable, will use it.

Change-Id: I1fb9b404b76864a8987f1e3baf209e0351c022b2
Closes-Bug: 1561855
'}]
commit_message:
Let BUILD_TIMEOUT in Ironic local.conf configurable

Before this fix:
BUILD_TIMEOUT is strict to 600 minutes
After this fix:
When BUILD_TIMEOUT has already been configured in environment
variable, will use it.

Change-Id: I1fb9b404b76864a8987f1e3baf209e0351c022b2
Closes-Bug: 1561855

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-14 12:20:45.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/wrappers/glance.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/wrappers/test_glance.py'], 'message': "Fix filters in glance v1 wrapper

As in glance v2, filters are passed as a keyword argument. Unlike
glance v2, owner is a separate kwarg, not a generic filter. Our old
implementation accidentally worked because the only filter we ever
used was 'owner', but it would have broken as soon as we tried to pass
literally any other filter.

Change-Id: If190f6edaf36b64524c2b15fd9060a1dce0f98fc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix filters in glance v1 wrapper

As in glance v2, filters are passed as a keyword argument. Unlike
glance v2, owner is a separate kwarg, not a generic filter. Our old
implementation accidentally worked because the only filter we ever
used was 'owner', but it would have broken as soon as we tried to pass
literally any other filter.

Change-Id: If190f6edaf36b64524c2b15fd9060a1dce0f98fc

subject: Need to check for /etc/ssh in $TARGET_ROOT
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 22:40:19.000000000', 'files': ['elements/simple-init/cleanup.d/90-remove-ssh-host-keys'], 'message': 'Need to check for /etc/ssh in $TARGET_ROOT

As cleanup.d scripts are run outside of the
chroot, we need to check for the existence of
/etc/ssh in $TARGET_ROOT. Some base OS elements,
such as ubuntu-minimal, will not have ssh by
default, which will cause this to fail.

Change-Id: Icecd7ba85f940f13891f345979ca05988817a6c5
'}]
commit_message:
Need to check for /etc/ssh in $TARGET_ROOT

As cleanup.d scripts are run outside of the
chroot, we need to check for the existence of
/etc/ssh in $TARGET_ROOT. Some base OS elements,
such as ubuntu-minimal, will not have ssh by
default, which will cause this to fail.

Change-Id: Icecd7ba85f940f13891f345979ca05988817a6c5

Provide a release postmortem

This patch introduces a postmortem template for the
Neutron project, and brings a draft for the Mitaka
release that would need to be filled with the help
of the Mitaka contributors before Mitaka is released.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-13 21:55:58.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/local.conf.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/stackrc.rst', 'doc/source/openrc.rst', 'doc/source/changes.rst', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'tox.ini', 'tools/build_docs.sh', 'doc/source/exerciserc.rst'], 'message': 'Remove shocco docs and other cleanups

This is a fairly opinionated change to do some spring cleaning on the
documentation.

The current output of shocco as rendered at [1] is completely broken.
I can not see that it is worth us maintaining this.  Honestly, the
github page does a better job at showing the scripts with a bit of
formatting.  The "changes" page is similarly useless today.  cgit or
github show allow browsing of changes in the repo better.  Both are
removed along with support scripts.

When you currently hit the first page, it gives no clue as to what
DevStack actually is.  Add a paragraph explaining that, and link to
the cgit for easy source browsing.

stackrc.rst is not necessary; the stuff about database backends is
already discussed in configuration.rst; move the things about service
repos into a section of configuration.rst.

The discussion in openrc.rst is moved into the configuration.rst file.

localrc.conf.rst was just a paragraph pointing back to
configuration.rst; this is removed.

The variables described in exercise.rst are moved into a separate
section of configuration.rst

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/#scripts

Change-Id: Ie7f4b265368f1d10a8908d75e11d625b2cc39e7c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove shocco docs and other cleanups

This is a fairly opinionated change to do some spring cleaning on the
documentation.

The current output of shocco as rendered at [1] is completely broken.
I can not see that it is worth us maintaining this.  Honestly, the
github page does a better job at showing the scripts with a bit of
formatting.  The "changes" page is similarly useless today.  cgit or
github show allow browsing of changes in the repo better.  Both are
removed along with support scripts.

When you currently hit the first page, it gives no clue as to what
DevStack actually is.  Add a paragraph explaining that, and link to
the cgit for easy source browsing.

stackrc.rst is not necessary; the stuff about database backends is
already discussed in configuration.rst; move the things about service
repos into a section of configuration.rst.

The discussion in openrc.rst is moved into the configuration.rst file.

localrc.conf.rst was just a paragraph pointing back to
configuration.rst; this is removed.

The variables described in exercise.rst are moved into a separate
section of configuration.rst

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/#scripts

Change-Id: Ie7f4b265368f1d10a8908d75e11d625b2cc39e7c

commit_message:
Change Registry Label for Server to Instance

The registry has OS::Nova::Server registered with a label of Server.

This is not consistent with "instance" naming in horizon.
This impacts usage in the search panel.

Before:
http://pasteboard.co/8wghjVS.png

After:
http://pasteboard.co/8whGcA1.png

Change-Id: I41e24b56afea127fdc6fc4f66d9d3b119807b649
Closes-Bug: 1569493

Moved doc file and releasenote from service_status

commit_message:
Add multipart content-type test

Previously, we only looked at content-type to determine whether to treat
a response as a multipart document. With the parent commit, we also
require a 206 response code.

This adds a test that would fail with the old code.

Change-Id: I24d9e5974bf74cb45b1dc66a5f4716c85ef10b10

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-14 16:07:55.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_running_check.yml'], 'message': 'removed duplicate key

In review of this role it was discovered that we had a duplicate
key within a task. While this is acceptable in Ansible as it will
just use the last key found in a given task it is wrong and should
be removed. In later version of Ansible (2.1.0) a warning is printed
stating something similar to the following:

   [WARNING]: While constructing a mapping from xxx.yml, line xx,
     column xx, found a duplicate dict key (changed_when).  Using
     last defined value only. [WARNING]: While constructing a mapping
     from xxx.yml, line xx, column xx, found a duplicate dict key
     (changed_when).  Using last defined value only.

This chage cleans up the role by removing the duplication.

Change-Id: I216987614b7783b9250c5ddc62bfae433423e775
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff665afd1a177d65b8a4131a952f2af8b6aa61da)
'}]
commit_message:
removed duplicate key

In review of this role it was discovered that we had a duplicate
key within a task. While this is acceptable in Ansible as it will
just use the last key found in a given task it is wrong and should
be removed. In later version of Ansible (2.1.0) a warning is printed
stating something similar to the following:

   [WARNING]: While constructing a mapping from xxx.yml, line xx,
     column xx, found a duplicate dict key (changed_when).  Using
     last defined value only. [WARNING]: While constructing a mapping
     from xxx.yml, line xx, column xx, found a duplicate dict key
     (changed_when).  Using last defined value only.

This chage cleans up the role by removing the duplication.

Change-Id: I216987614b7783b9250c5ddc62bfae433423e775
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff665afd1a177d65b8a4131a952f2af8b6aa61da)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-08 00:15:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Clear stale SNAT namespace when agent restarts after router move

When we move (manual move) a router from one dvr_snat node to
another dvr_snat node the snat_namespace should be removed by
the originating node by the agent and will be recreated in the
destination node by the destination agent.

But when the agent dies, the router_update message cannot reach
the agent and so the snat_namespace is untouched.

After the agent restarts, the agent should remove the
snat_namespace since it is no more hosted by the current agent.

Even though we do have the agent take care of stale namespaces on
a agent restart, this particular use case is not handled right.

This patch provides a fix for cleaning up just the snat namespace
on the dvr_snat node where the router binding was removed.

Change-Id: I6bc1646a81bafb024186865b3ce72af3d4c7228a
Closes-Bug: #1557909
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Clear stale SNAT namespace when agent restarts after router move

When we move (manual move) a router from one dvr_snat node to
another dvr_snat node the snat_namespace should be removed by
the originating node by the agent and will be recreated in the
destination node by the destination agent.

But when the agent dies, the router_update message cannot reach
the agent and so the snat_namespace is untouched.

After the agent restarts, the agent should remove the
snat_namespace since it is no more hosted by the current agent.

Even though we do have the agent take care of stale namespaces on
a agent restart, this particular use case is not handled right.

This patch provides a fix for cleaning up just the snat namespace
on the dvr_snat node where the router binding was removed.

Change-Id: I6bc1646a81bafb024186865b3ce72af3d4c7228a
Closes-Bug: #1557909

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Closes-Bug: #1552251

subject: Make rsync ignore it's own temporary files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-15 00:30:37.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/probe/test_object_handoff.py'], 'message': "Make rsync ignore it's own temporary files

In situations where rsync may inadvertently be unable to cleanup it's
temporary files we shouldn't spread them around the cluster.

By asking our rsync subexec to --exclude patterns that match it's own
convention for temporary naming we'll only ever transfer real replicated
artifacts and never temporary artifacts which should always be ignored
until they are fully transfered.

Cleanup of stale rsync droppings should be performed by the auditor and
will be addressed in a separate change related to lp bug #1554005.

Closes-Bug: #1553995

Change-Id: Ibe598b339af024d05e4d89c34d696e972d8189ff
"}]
commit_message:
Make rsync ignore it's own temporary files

In situations where rsync may inadvertently be unable to cleanup it's
temporary files we shouldn't spread them around the cluster.

By asking our rsync subexec to --exclude patterns that match it's own
convention for temporary naming we'll only ever transfer real replicated
artifacts and never temporary artifacts which should always be ignored
until they are fully transfered.

Cleanup of stale rsync droppings should be performed by the auditor and
will be addressed in a separate change related to lp bug #1554005.

Closes-Bug: #1553995

Change-Id: Ibe598b339af024d05e4d89c34d696e972d8189ff

commit_message:
Add network options to security group rule create

Add the following network options to the "os security group rule"
command:
  (1) --ingress and --egress
  (2) --ethertype
These options enable egress and IPv6 security group rules for
Network v2.

Change-Id: Ie30b5e95f94e0c087b0ce81e518de72d2dda25ad
Partial-Bug: #1519512
Implements: blueprint neutron-client

subject: Prefer assertEqual/assertIn over assertOutput/assertInOutput
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-06 19:01:10.000000000', 'files': ['functional/tests/identity/v3/test_project.py', 'functional/tests/common/test_quota.py', 'functional/tests/identity/v2/test_endpoint.py', 'functional/tests/identity/v3/test_endpoint.py', 'functional/tests/identity/v3/test_group.py'], 'message': 'Prefer assertEqual/assertIn over assertOutput/assertInOutput

functional.common.tests module defines:

 * assertOutput (similar to assertEqual)
 * assertInOutput (similar to assertIn)

in order to allow the usage of assertions in testcase classmethods but
there is no reason to use them in testcase instancemethods at least
because they raise Exception instances instead of AssertionError
instances.

Change-Id: I9ffcaf9c6e6a1ff5df6ea2d79be3fb4496db4b85
'}]
commit_message:
Prefer assertEqual/assertIn over assertOutput/assertInOutput

functional.common.tests module defines:

 * assertOutput (similar to assertEqual)
 * assertInOutput (similar to assertIn)

in order to allow the usage of assertions in testcase classmethods but
there is no reason to use them in testcase instancemethods at least
because they raise Exception instances instead of AssertionError
instances.

Change-Id: I9ffcaf9c6e6a1ff5df6ea2d79be3fb4496db4b85

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-14 18:32:59.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/horizon-enable-password-autocomplete-5f8f78a6c8f1edb3.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'templates/horizon_local_settings.py.j2'], 'message': 'Optionally allow autocomplete in Horizon

Horizon disables password autocompletion by default. This causes
problems for users who use password managers and want to store
their Horizon credentials. This patch adds a variable that allows

Release notes are included.

Change-Id: I8eaa5a1773e6f182c436b312f2733a21505a867c
Closes-Bug: 1570505
'}]
commit_message:
Optionally allow autocomplete in Horizon

Horizon disables password autocompletion by default. This causes
problems for users who use password managers and want to store
their Horizon credentials. This patch adds a variable that allows
a deployer to override this default.

Release notes are included.

Change-Id: I8eaa5a1773e6f182c436b312f2733a21505a867c

commit_message:
Use oslo module for messaging (rabbit) configuration

Additonal changes:

  * switch messaging related parameters to $::os_service_default
    as they are used in oslo::messaging_rabbit define
  * update unit tests
  * update docs for notify::rabbitmq class
  * drop deprecated rabbit_durable_queues parameter
  * fix notification parameters according to mitaka config file

Change-Id: Ib20c13f136a299c958d9ac064e8ad93ceb0ebd40

commit_message:
Verify pci_passthrough_whitelist fields

It's currently possible to supply an empty string for devname,
also it's currently possible to have an entry that lacks a
devname, address, and both product and vendor ids.

Added checks for invalid entries, mainly devname containing
an empty string, only specifying physical_address, and only providing
one of the two ids.

Added tests for these invalid entries.

Added exception/message for these invalid entries.

Change-Id: I8133393febab051eca9a3b61835ad8ce81cb3087
Closes-Bug: #1466451

commit_message:
Fix API validation of DPDK properties on the node's interfaces

Now validator does not recalculate DPDK availability but takes
its value from DB.
Also, validator now works properly when 'dpdk' section does not
present in API request.

Change-Id: Ief7f496c0de3ac3c1c09003f72d3c4056a57f749
Partial-Bug: #1564102

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: Idfe2d99f8dae191fa6c7ab897a1d2b4f9491b2fa
Closes-Bug: #1552251

subject: fernet: make it working out of the box
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 8318, 'name': 'Matthew J Black', 'email': 'mjblack@gmail.com', 'username': 'mjblack'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-14 03:29:31.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fernet_path-37ea6f89710f09c2.yaml', 'spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "fernet: make it working out of the box

1) run the Exec with keystone user
When creating fernet files, if we don't run keystone-manage with
keystone user, Puppet will run it as root, and
/var/log/keystone/keystone.log will have wrong permissions, and db_sync
will fail later.
We need to ensure that exec is run with the right user.

2) deploy keys in /var/lib/keystone/fernet-keys instead of
/etc/keystone/fernet-keys.
Using /etc/keystone/fernet-keys does not work because Keystone has
permissions issues when creating the fernet keys. This change is not
backward compatible but since it did not work before, we think this is
acceptable. A release note explains it.

Closes-Bug: #1551864
Change-Id: I74fc7b3295207d24269dff25f4a18ff557b64910
"}]
commit_message:
fernet: make it working out of the box

1) run the Exec with keystone user
When creating fernet files, if we don't run keystone-manage with
keystone user, Puppet will run it as root, and
/var/log/keystone/keystone.log will have wrong permissions, and db_sync
will fail later.
We need to ensure that exec is run with the right user.

2) deploy keys in /var/lib/keystone/fernet-keys instead of
/etc/keystone/fernet-keys.
Using /etc/keystone/fernet-keys does not work because Keystone has
permissions issues when creating the fernet keys. This change is not
backward compatible but since it did not work before, we think this is
acceptable. A release note explains it.

Closes-Bug: #1551864
Change-Id: I74fc7b3295207d24269dff25f4a18ff557b64910

subject: repos/centos: deploy Ceph with SIG and get rid of EPEL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 13:18:43.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/ceph.pp', 'manifests/repos.pp'], 'message': "repos/centos: deploy Ceph with SIG and get rid of EPEL

This patch will change the way we deployed Ceph on CentOS nodes.

* Use CentOS SIG by default
https://wiki.centos.org/SpecialInterestGroup/Storage/

* Stop deploying EPEL, which is conflicting with RDO packaging.

All our CI needs should be in RDO and SIG. Let's stop deploying EPEL at
all.

Change-Id: I8d435a77c41c38354b20a40ab30dbc595cb6412c
(cherry picked from commit cb015ed05b2105daa53262297dd3da05786f4f9e)
"}]
commit_message:
repos/centos: deploy Ceph with SIG and get rid of EPEL

This patch will change the way we deployed Ceph on CentOS nodes.

* Use CentOS SIG by default
https://wiki.centos.org/SpecialInterestGroup/Storage/

* Stop deploying EPEL, which is conflicting with RDO packaging.

All our CI needs should be in RDO and SIG. Let's stop deploying EPEL at
all.

Change-Id: I8d435a77c41c38354b20a40ab30dbc595cb6412c
(cherry picked from commit cb015ed05b2105daa53262297dd3da05786f4f9e)

subject: Add canvas timeline implementation
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-04-07 01:03:48.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/directives/timeline-viewport.js', 'app/js/directives/timeline.js', 'app/js/directives/timeline-dstat.js', 'app/js/directives/timeline-overview.js'], 'message': 'Add canvas timeline implementation

This adds a new timeline renderer using a plain canvas element,
replacing the d3 and svg-based renderer. This new implementation
greatly improves timeline performance, especially on less powerful
graphics cards, and more than doubles the resulting framerate while
panning the view by aggressively caching previously rendered chart
regions. Additionally, worst-case memory usage is greatly reduced
during heavier periods of user interaction.

This new implementation also removes several previous limitations.
Due to cached rendering a nearly unlimited number of objects can be
shown at any time with no performance impact, so small objects never
need to be hidden from view at any zoom level. Also, view transitions
can now be smoothly animated, and reach a stable framerate even on
older mobile devices.

Change-Id: Ib883e056270eff688b4b4a0c340eaea20cceb181
'}]
commit_message:
Add canvas timeline implementation

This adds a new timeline renderer using a plain canvas element,
replacing the d3 and svg-based renderer. This new implementation
greatly improves timeline performance, especially on less powerful
graphics cards, and more than doubles the resulting framerate while
panning the view by aggressively caching previously rendered chart
regions. Additionally, worst-case memory usage is greatly reduced
during heavier periods of user interaction.

This new implementation also removes several previous limitations.
Due to cached rendering a nearly unlimited number of objects can be
shown at any time with no performance impact, so small objects never
need to be hidden from view at any zoom level. Also, view transitions
can now be smoothly animated, and reach a stable framerate even on
older mobile devices.

Change-Id: Ib883e056270eff688b4b4a0c340eaea20cceb181

commit_message:
Set db connection retry to infinity

Make sure that all the sevices will attempt to
connect to the database an infinite about of times.
If the database ever disappears for some reason we
want the services to try and reconnect more than just
10 times.

Closes-bug: #1505636
Change-Id: I77abbf72ce5bfd68faa451bb9a72bd2544963f4b

commit_message:
Fix ovs creation of the port

This patch fix the mac address of the port to the right value.
It also creates the port atomically (with the various details),
avoiding it to be misinterpreted by ovs-agent.

Change-Id: I16f89a30ac3b47eeaa5edddd37712934729fdf93
Closes-Bug: 1569412

commit_message:
Fix API validation of DPDK properties on the node's interfaces

Now validator does not validate DPDK availability. It's always
calculated on the fly.
Also, validator now works properly when 'dpdk' section does not
present in API request.

Change-Id: Ibaf7919ac0068cdb6a1be93b74ebc0c4886ac934
Partial-Bug: #1564102

commit_message:
Fix heat trustee configuration

Based on: I6305be3c693993de4d16d82fd6de936e92c437c5
Removing project_domain_id and project_name since they cannot be
specified in this section or keystone will throw a "cannot be scoped
to multiple targets error" and auth_uri is unused by the
keystoneclient password auth plugins.

Backport of I6b4eb2301690038b717a0b51490036dd30e76edd

Change-Id: I149226977398506ac4ae56589fc7ccc92f6d9384
Closes-Bug: 1565550

subject: Add logic check for xenial APT mirrors
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-14 15:35:24.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/configure_mirror.sh'], 'message': "Add logic check for xenial APT mirrors

Because reprepro will not mirror repositories with 0 packages,
xenial-backports, xenial-updates, xenial-security are missing from
AFS.  Until we have them populated, we'll only configure APT to use
the xenial mirror.

Change-Id: Id4d788097ae4e1a5d0f13cb84a46fbb9ac9a839e
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add logic check for xenial APT mirrors

Because reprepro will not mirror repositories with 0 packages,
xenial-backports, xenial-updates, xenial-security are missing from
AFS.  Until we have them populated, we'll only configure APT to use
the xenial mirror.

Change-Id: Id4d788097ae4e1a5d0f13cb84a46fbb9ac9a839e
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Reduce mDNS logging during retries

During poll_for_serial_number, we log too much info.
Reduce this down to debug level, and log a warning
only upon failure to retrieve the expected serial.

Change-Id: I58557f0cbb4de6987653324ee7bda92f00c35a97

subject: Use multiple UDP response sockets for DNS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-15 09:09:09.000000000', 'files': ['designate/service.py'], 'message': 'Use multiple UDP response sockets for DNS

Eventlet would complain loudly about multiple readers/writers
to the UDP DNS socket, use a separate UDP socket for responses
to avoid this scenario.

Change-Id: I9e3d0474e6124617925859c0d03e831ca75c79ad
Closes-Bug: 1471789
'}]
commit_message:
Use multiple UDP response sockets for DNS

Eventlet would complain loudly about multiple readers/writers
to the UDP DNS socket, use a separate UDP socket for responses
to avoid this scenario.

Change-Id: I9e3d0474e6124617925859c0d03e831ca75c79ad
Closes-Bug: 1471789

subject: Security fuzz tests for RecordSets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-05 18:41:23.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v2/test_recordset_security.py'], 'message': 'Security fuzz tests for RecordSets

These tests will attempt various CRUD operations, and attempt to inject
different kinds of "fuzz strings" into the requests to try to get
unexpected results. Currently, most API methods will be tested for the
following issues:

- Remote code execution (RCE)
- SQL injection (SQLi)
- Second-order cross-site scripting (XSS)
- DoS/500 errors via various junk payloads (conversion errors, etc.)

Depends-On: I3f8e3f65061f18f3242d34a7e529b2f652bd573e
Depends-On: I2e404a0c66d54b64915d196910ce87f4886d118a
Change-Id: I7ca0359529cfa77a689aa134746e9bd4439e898a

commit_message:
Security fuzz tests for RecordSets

These tests will attempt various CRUD operations, and attempt to inject
different kinds of "fuzz strings" into the requests to try to get
unexpected results. Currently, most API methods will be tested for the
following issues:

- Remote code execution (RCE)
- SQL injection (SQLi)
- Second-order cross-site scripting (XSS)
- DoS/500 errors via various junk payloads (conversion errors, etc.)

Depends-On: I3f8e3f65061f18f3242d34a7e529b2f652bd573e
Depends-On: I2e404a0c66d54b64915d196910ce87f4886d118a
Change-Id: I7ca0359529cfa77a689aa134746e9bd4439e898a

commit_message:
Improve logging in designate.backend

We should delegate (when possible) formatting to the logger in order to
perform formatting only when needed, by using:

LOG.<level>(message, data)

instead of:

LOG.<level>(message % data)

and

 try:
   ...
 except ...:
   LOG.exception("lorem ipsum")

instead of:

 try:
   ...
 except ... as e:
   LOG.error("lorem ipsum: %s:", e)

This change also remove oslo.log module import but unused.

Change-Id: Icf8879d0cd4db63ef4656d4a1ceba4d3c8bf29d7

subject: Changes volume_services default value for mitaka
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 17:38:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Changes volume_services default value for mitaka

When requesting the list of services by hostname from cinder
in previos releases like kilo and liberty the list would filter
out those hosts that had the format host@backend, but in mitaka
those hosts are included in the list. So in order for the
test_get_service_by_host_name to work fine for mitaka, the
volume_services config value should be set to True. Currently it
is set to False to match liberty release.

This change sets the volume_services default value to True so the
test works properly in the mitaka release.

It is related to change Id72863c4a4fa77aff42a7e69e7e8be8080166ae5

Closes-Bug: #1568959

Change-Id: I8ec19ff19b831df75f4602d7a544792d253e10f2
'}]
commit_message:
Changes volume_services default value for mitaka

When requesting the list of services by hostname from cinder
in previos releases like kilo and liberty the list would filter
out those hosts that had the format host@backend, but in mitaka
those hosts are included in the list. So in order for the
test_get_service_by_host_name to work fine for mitaka, the
volume_services config value should be set to True. Currently it
is set to False to match liberty release.

This change sets the volume_services default value to True so the
test works properly in the mitaka release.

It is related to change Id72863c4a4fa77aff42a7e69e7e8be8080166ae5

Closes-Bug: #1568959

Change-Id: I8ec19ff19b831df75f4602d7a544792d253e10f2

commit_message:
Fixed connection limit for HA Proxy

Set maxconn in global section instead of frontend.
Because frontend's maxconn is not applied.

Change-Id: Iadef5f8fc1436255287f67474726731d8527d399
Closes-bug: #1544861
Signed-off-by: Takashi Okamoto <okamoto_takashi_p3@lab.ntt.co.jp>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-26 15:59:24.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/ceph-volume-migrate.rst'], 'message': "Support volume migration in Ceph driver

If volume migration is supported in Ceph driver, we could offload
volume migration from cinder-volume host to ceph cluster. It could make
full use of ceph's inherent data copy feature and the hardware capacity
of ceph storage cluster to expedite the volume data copy speed, and
reduce the IO load on cinder-volume host.

blueprint ceph-volume-migrate

Change-Id: I05fa577f640594025f8f68fe96d9f5118f987aab
"}]
commit_message:
Support volume migration in Ceph driver

If volume migration is supported in Ceph driver, we could offload
volume migration from cinder-volume host to ceph cluster. It could make
full use of ceph's inherent data copy feature and the hardware capacity
of ceph storage cluster to expedite the volume data copy speed, and
reduce the IO load on cinder-volume host.

blueprint ceph-volume-migrate

Change-Id: I05fa577f640594025f8f68fe96d9f5118f987aab

commit_message:
Support to add certificate in ironic-agent

This commits provides support to add certificate while
building the image using ironic-agent element. The
certificate can be CA certificate or self-signed certificate.

The certificate is set to the environment variable
'DIB_IPA_CERT' which in turn is used by the ironic-agent
element while building the image.

Change-Id: I648f7934d4787dcc3030885cfca771b642a9595e

commit_message:
Use InAnyOrder for role creation mocks

The user/roles can be created in any order due to
python random seed ordering dictionaries, so the
mocks should be in random order

Change-Id: I23a9380fb65ac634831beb496af388381d0230d4
Partial-Bug: #1348818

commit_message:
206 status check for multipart mime doc

Add a 206 status check along with content-type check to ensure we are
decrypting multipart mime doc- avoids situation when user may want to
store multipart mime doc

subject: Iptables firewall prevent IP spoofed DHCP requests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 21:09:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_securitygroups_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': 'Iptables firewall prevent IP spoofed DHCP requests

The DHCP rules in the fixed iptables firewall rules were too permissive.
They permitted any UDP traffic with a source port of 68 and destination
port of 67. Care must be taken since these rules return before the IP
spoofing prevention rules. This patch splits the fixed DHCP rules into
two, one for the discovery and request messages which take place before
the instance has bound an IP address and a second to permit DHCP
renewals.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_firewall.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_securitygroups_rpc.py

Change-Id: Ibc2b0fa80baf2ea8b01fa568cd1fe7a7e092e7a5
Partial-Bug: #1558658
(cherry picked from commit 6a93ee8ac1a901c255e3475a24f1afc11d8bf80f)
'}]
commit_message:
Iptables firewall prevent IP spoofed DHCP requests

The DHCP rules in the fixed iptables firewall rules were too permissive.
They permitted any UDP traffic with a source port of 68 and destination
port of 67. Care must be taken since these rules return before the IP
spoofing prevention rules. This patch splits the fixed DHCP rules into
two, one for the discovery and request messages which take place before
the instance has bound an IP address and a second to permit DHCP
renewals.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_firewall.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_securitygroups_rpc.py

Change-Id: Ibc2b0fa80baf2ea8b01fa568cd1fe7a7e092e7a5
Partial-Bug: #1558658
(cherry picked from commit 6a93ee8ac1a901c255e3475a24f1afc11d8bf80f)

commit_message:
Iptables firewall prevent IP spoofed DHCP requests

The DHCP rules in the fixed iptables firewall rules were too permissive.
They permitted any UDP traffic with a source port of 68 and destination
port of 67. Care must be taken since these rules return before the IP
spoofing prevention rules. This patch splits the fixed DHCP rules into
two, one for the discovery and request messages which take place before
the instance has bound an IP address and a second to permit DHCP
renewals.

	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_firewall.py

Iptables firewall prevent IP spoofed DHCP requests

The DHCP rules in the fixed iptables firewall rules were too permissive.
They permitted any UDP traffic with a source port of 68 and destination
port of 67. Care must be taken since these rules return before the IP
spoofing prevention rules. This patch splits the fixed DHCP rules into

commit_message:
Revert "Add migration for new ceph fields"

This reverts commit 014734cb34f51e5d8785bcef9f7e8a998e21316e.

That commit broke our nailgun tests. E.g.,
http://logs.openstack.org/11/305811/3/check/gate-fuel-web-python27-db/f4a5fcb/console.html

2016-04-14 15:35:21.717 |     def upgrade_ceph_cluster_attrs():
2016-04-14 15:35:21.717 |         connection = op.get_bind()
2016-04-14 15:35:21.717 |     
2016-04-14 15:35:21.717 |         for cluster_id, editable in connection.execute(q_get_cluster_attrs):
2016-04-14 15:35:21.718 |             editable = jsonutils.loads(editable)
2016-04-14 15:35:21.718 | >           editable['storage'].update(ceph_storage_attrs)
2016-04-14 15:35:21.718 | E           KeyError: 'storage'

Change-Id: I08fdc13186e1fc4b0747f7c0a886c1d116c1e65d

subject: run_tests: uninstall epel-release
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-14 13:06:20.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'run_tests: uninstall epel-release

epel-release is installed by OpenStack Infra when building images.
The problem is RDO + EPEL does not work find, there are some
dependencies issues.

This patch makes sure EPEL is not installed when we start our CI jobs.
The next steps will be to run puppet-openstack-integration with EPEL
disabled in ceph::repo, and patch ceph::repo to use centos ceph repos [1]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-ceph/+bug/1562998

This patch is part of the efforts to stop using EPEL at all.

Change-Id: I506754e2c5021ee728675a8771f2e24b8576f7d5
(cherry picked from commit 625da96a42278091561b012d5441389f72c32dd6)
'}]
commit_message:
run_tests: uninstall epel-release

epel-release is installed by OpenStack Infra when building images.
The problem is RDO + EPEL does not work find, there are some
dependencies issues.

This patch makes sure EPEL is not installed when we start our CI jobs.
The next steps will be to run puppet-openstack-integration with EPEL
disabled in ceph::repo, and patch ceph::repo to use centos ceph repos [1]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-ceph/+bug/1562998

This patch is part of the efforts to stop using EPEL at all.

Change-Id: I506754e2c5021ee728675a8771f2e24b8576f7d5
(cherry picked from commit 625da96a42278091561b012d5441389f72c32dd6)

commit_message:
Fix KeyError when rename to a name is already in use

When a user attempts to rename a project via the PATCH
v3/projects/{project_id} API, and the new name is already in-use, rather
than return a nice error explaining that the name is in use, keystone
blows up and raises `KeyError: 'is_domain'` in
_generate_project_name_conflict_msg.

Change-Id: I56fcd8fe1258e2d1de3e541144649ef619f86a7b
Closes-bug: #1565108

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-28 10:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/firewall.py'], 'message': 'New api for bulk port-updates

Currently there is no api available for bulk port updates,
which takes a list of ports .
Having one will help in processing port-updates quickly as per
the specific driver implementation
For example: In hyperv port-updates taking long time when done
sequentially and has good results using multithreaded approach.
This patch is raised so that existence of an api like this will
enable the devolopers to leverage this api if required.

Closes-Bug: #1510845

Change-Id: I134d386783a15a5c35ab4822961c35bbb92a6377
'}]
commit_message:
New api for bulk port-updates

Currently there is no api available for bulk port updates,
which takes a list of ports .
Having one will help in processing port-updates quickly as per
the specific driver implementation
For example: In hyperv port-updates taking long time when done
sequentially and has good results using multithreaded approach.
This patch is raised so that existence of an api like this will
enable the devolopers to leverage this api if required.

Closes-Bug: #1510845

Change-Id: I134d386783a15a5c35ab4822961c35bbb92a6377

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-05 00:40:19.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/plugins/ml2.pp'], 'message': 'Add ml2 package requirement to neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver

In certain scenarios the neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver was being
executed before the $::neutron::params::ml2_server_package which

Change-Id: I31fa00030201b86baca14f9cb3bccab91c593e85
'}]
commit_message:
Add ml2 package requirement to neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver

In certain scenarios the neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver was being
executed before the $::neutron::params::ml2_server_package which
caused problems while trying to write plugin files.

Change-Id: I31fa00030201b86baca14f9cb3bccab91c593e85

commit_message:
Use values from endpoint map for service endpoints

Instead of using values hardcoded in os-cloud-config. This commit
uses the values that come from the endpoint map that's used
in the t-h-t. This in turns, allows us to be able to change the
port and even the host used for the public and internal endpoints;
this is still not the case for the admin endpoints, as it is based
on the internal endpoint of the service. The aforementioned
limitation comes from os-cloud-config.

Change-Id: I0cf9ada1110f6b1452480039c136aee1fc3ccc82
Depends-On: I4cc5bbf2e7200f78cd90b93659c326a9200278d7
Depends-On: I07accff0914b93be09adf17a2552c5c922236c2e

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-04 07:35:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/callbacks/manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/callbacks/test_manager.py', 'doc/source/devref/callbacks.rst', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'callback for AFTER_XXX event also need raise the exception

Currently, only exception raised for callback registered for BEFORE_ and
PRECOMMIT_ events, but not for AFTER_ event. It will cover some error
inside the AFTER_ callback.

For example, sync_from_callback in networking-odl will re-raise the error
from HTTP request to ODL. But the exception will not be returned back to
user which make tempest testcases passed finally.

Change-Id: Ice2141628adc2d6175c650ff8296bed8a76a6ad5
Closes-bug:#1546422
Closes-bug:#1539333
'}]
commit_message:
callback for AFTER_XXX event also need raise the exception

Currently, only exception raised for callback registered for BEFORE_ and
PRECOMMIT_ events, but not for AFTER_ event. It will cover some error
inside the AFTER_ callback.

For example, sync_from_callback in networking-odl will re-raise the error
from HTTP request to ODL. But the exception will not be returned back to
user which make tempest testcases passed finally.

Change-Id: Ice2141628adc2d6175c650ff8296bed8a76a6ad5
Closes-bug:#1546422
Closes-bug:#1539333

commit_message:
Add EndpointMap as output

The endpoint map contains, not only the hosts and protocols that
the resulting services will use, but also the ports. This
information is useful, and the aim of this patch is to make it
available for the tripleoclient to use it.

Change-Id: I4cc5bbf2e7200f78cd90b93659c326a9200278d7
Bug: #1569851
(cherry picked from commit 321cee7616186e83e9a5eff9e9a9abe9b9f82fab)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 10:17:20.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/ceph/manifests/mon.pp'], 'message': 'Fix unless condition for ceph-deploy

In case of using an array parameter in Exec {unless}, it will run only if all
commands are false. However, we need to execute it if any of conditional
commands is false.

Change-Id: I002c734ffdbd6e6f69ff83c5f98e503e09503356
Closes-bug: #1565703
(cherry picked from commit f95c6344dce9c7caa3fe86da3a38521a2e63111c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unless condition for ceph-deploy

In case of using an array parameter in Exec {unless}, it will run only if all
commands are false. However, we need to execute it if any of conditional
commands is false.

Change-Id: I002c734ffdbd6e6f69ff83c5f98e503e09503356
Closes-bug: #1565703
(cherry picked from commit f95c6344dce9c7caa3fe86da3a38521a2e63111c)

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-02-18 10:12:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/common/l3_test_common.py'], 'message': 'DVR: avoid connection loss on floating ip associate

Problem is explained in bug report
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1456624/comments/7

To avoid connection loss on floating ip associate for existing connections,
we will continue routing packets belonging to existing connections through
SNAT gateway[2] by marking packets and routing them through new
fwmark[6] routes to SNAT gateway.

1) create snat redirect route(with fwmark)[6] for redirecting marked packets to SNAT
default gateway(table)[2]. This is route is created per router internal port(subnet).
This rule have more priority over floating ip rule [3] on that subnet.

2) Mark(using conntrack) the existing conntrack connections[7] with the same fwmark
key value used by ip rule [7]

3) Restore the packet mark(using iptables[8]), from the connection mark, so that packet
will be handled by route with fwmark

All ip rules(including new fwmark rule) in compute node will look like [1] with this change.

[1] 32769:  from 10.0.0.1/24 fwmark 0xa000001 lookup 167772161
    32777:  from 10.0.0.8 lookup 16
    167772161:      from 10.0.0.1/24 lookup 167772161

[2] 167772161:      from 10.0.0.1/24 lookup 167772161
    ip route show table 167772161
    default via 10.0.0.7 dev qr-8804a198-ea
[3] 32777:  from 10.0.0.8 lookup 16
[6] 32769:  from 10.0.0.1/24 fwmark 0xa000001 lookup 167772161
[7] icmp 1 29 src=10.0.0.8 dst=8.8.8.8 [UNREPLIED] src=8.8.8.8 dst=10.0.0.8 mark=167772161 use=1
[8] CONNMARK  all  --  *  *  10.0.0.8  0.0.0.0/0  ctorigsrc 10.0.0.8 CONNMARK restore

Closes-bug: #1456624
Change-Id: Ia668f48972a665ad8307d44fab26f7b1668b65e1
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: avoid connection loss on floating ip associate

Problem is explained in bug report
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1456624/comments/7

To avoid connection loss on floating ip associate for existing connections,
we will continue routing packets belonging to existing connections through
SNAT gateway[2] by marking packets and routing them through new
fwmark[6] routes to SNAT gateway.

1) create snat redirect route(with fwmark)[6] for redirecting marked packets to SNAT
default gateway(table)[2]. This is route is created per router internal port(subnet).
This rule have more priority over floating ip rule [3] on that subnet.

2) Mark(using conntrack) the existing conntrack connections[7] with the same fwmark
key value used by ip rule [7]

3) Restore the packet mark(using iptables[8]), from the connection mark, so that packet
will be handled by route with fwmark

All ip rules(including new fwmark rule) in compute node will look like [1] with this change.

[1] 32769:  from 10.0.0.1/24 fwmark 0xa000001 lookup 167772161
    32777:  from 10.0.0.8 lookup 16
    167772161:      from 10.0.0.1/24 lookup 167772161

[2] 167772161:      from 10.0.0.1/24 lookup 167772161
    ip route show table 167772161
    default via 10.0.0.7 dev qr-8804a198-ea
[3] 32777:  from 10.0.0.8 lookup 16
[6] 32769:  from 10.0.0.1/24 fwmark 0xa000001 lookup 167772161
[7] icmp 1 29 src=10.0.0.8 dst=8.8.8.8 [UNREPLIED] src=8.8.8.8 dst=10.0.0.8 mark=167772161 use=1
[8] CONNMARK  all  --  *  *  10.0.0.8  0.0.0.0/0  ctorigsrc 10.0.0.8 CONNMARK restore

Closes-bug: #1456624
Change-Id: Ia668f48972a665ad8307d44fab26f7b1668b65e1

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-24 22:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/config.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/test_db_api.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/test_driver.py', 'neutron/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/db_api.py', 'neutron/ipam/exceptions.py', 'neutron/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/driver.py'], 'message': "WIP: Use compare-and-swap for IpamAvailabilityRange

WIP: Enabled pluggable IPAM

Existing locking mechanism 'select for update' causes
deadlocks with galera multi-writers.
Replaced locking rows with compare-and-swap approach.

Compare-and-swap verifies that row is not changed by
another thread before updating/deleting it.
Filter-and-update and filter-and-delete are used.
They return count of affected rows.
If count of affected row is less than expected,
then another thread already changed our row
and RetryRequest is raised.

Change-Id: I514cae0fa43033433ec2982bcf3726e02e6692bf
Closes-Bug: #1494351
(cherry picked from commit d755f7248d324bb4c44b3efc9d200f8eb075066d)
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Use compare-and-swap for IpamAvailabilityRange

WIP: Enabled pluggable IPAM

Existing locking mechanism 'select for update' causes
deadlocks with galera multi-writers.
Replaced locking rows with compare-and-swap approach.

Compare-and-swap verifies that row is not changed by
another thread before updating/deleting it.
Filter-and-update and filter-and-delete are used.
They return count of affected rows.
If count of affected row is less than expected,
then another thread already changed our row
and RetryRequest is raised.

Change-Id: I514cae0fa43033433ec2982bcf3726e02e6692bf
Closes-Bug: #1494351
(cherry picked from commit d755f7248d324bb4c44b3efc9d200f8eb075066d)

subject: Extend the str2dict to support the dict list in cmdline
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-17 01:36:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/common/utils.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Extend the str2dict to support the dict list in cmdline

Currently when update fixed-ips, {subnet_id=xx,ip_address=xx} will be translated
to two requirement respectively, will generate two ip for one subnet.
But actually user just want to add one IP with the specified subnet_id.
This patch extend the str2dict function to process the string like below. It use
';' to divide the string wrapped with "". Then it will get a list of dict.

--fixed-ips type=dict  "{subnet_id=xx,ip_address=xx};{subnet_id=xx}"

Change-Id: I03b302f0a1c60bfe4da1d6c18eadb9939ab46940
Partial-Bug: #1341096
'}]
commit_message:
Extend the str2dict to support the dict list in cmdline

Currently when update fixed-ips, {subnet_id=xx,ip_address=xx} will be translated
to two requirement respectively, will generate two ip for one subnet.
But actually user just want to add one IP with the specified subnet_id.
This patch extend the str2dict function to process the string like below. It use
';' to divide the string wrapped with "". Then it will get a list of dict.

--fixed-ips type=dict  "{subnet_id=xx,ip_address=xx};{subnet_id=xx}"

Change-Id: I03b302f0a1c60bfe4da1d6c18eadb9939ab46940
Partial-Bug: #1341096

commit_message:
Deny extra arguments for router gateway and interface CLIs

For router-gateway-set/clear, router-interface-add/delete commands,
if user passed some wrong arguments, no error will shown.
This patch deny extra arguments for these commands and display an error message.

Change-Id: I68cb9b03c211eece32ab77dea866fd8f98dfab63
Closes-Bug: #1535209

commit_message:
Add --router:external to net-create arguments

router:external is not in CreateNetwork known_arguments. This allows
help message of router:external to output when creating a network through
cli.

Change-Id: I644ca6f4797b7c7564e0d62da44126957177de78
Closes-Bug: #1552721

commit_message:
OVS-agent: Deprecate drop_flows_on_start

This option has no clear use-cases for end users.
Let's remove it after a cycle.  At that point the new behaviour
(graceful restart) should have been proved stable.

Change-Id: I196e012b5a37594bf8eeb497ccea41afb822cfd1

commit_message:
Set VXLAN UDP destination port using Linux Bridge

Fix Cannot set the VXLAN UDP destination port to 4789 using Linux Bridge

DocImpact: Add option of the VXLAN UDP destination port with Linux Bridge,
set default to 8472 to not break existing installations that haven't specified
vxlan_udp_port so far.

Change-Id: If8175ed2cb2a74d31b8c65e19c3b2832ac8adc4d
Closes-Bug: #1483853

commit_message:
Fix floatingip status for an HA router

When we associate a floatingip in an HA router setup, it is properly
associated. However, when we check the status of the Floating ip, it
is shown as empty.  The L3 agent ha_router implementation never sets
the status of the floating IP when it's added.  This behavior blocks
tempest scenario tests that use FIPs when run against a deployment
with L3 agent HA routers.  This fix sets the FIP status to active
when the FIP is added by an HaRouter instance.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_legacy_router.py

Co-Authored-By: Assaf Muller <amuller@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1449049
Change-Id: I7a3de36b64132e483a927ce9fed30777e84df96a
(cherry picked from commit 30e048d222c23c8fa07f70fa2d6a820fa0c88e0c)

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-12-22 07:26:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py'], 'message': 'Disabling/Re-enabling ML2 type driver create orphan n/w segments

Currently a warning is documented for ML2 type driver configuration
saying "Disabling a ML2 type driver and re-enabling it later may
lead to database inconsistencies if ML2 is reconfigured without
support for that type.". But there hasn't been any clear consensus
on what will be the correct fix for this. Some solutions have been
proposed that fixes the problem in a SQL query/script fix.

In this proposed solution, there are no foreign key based database
triggers/database scripts for the admin. Currently the segments are
released by the type driver loaded specific to that type. So this
change intends to use the type driver to release the segment.
Type manager loads all type drivers from the namespace. From this
list it then registers the enabled and disabled drivers using the
"type_drivers" config option. These disabled drivers will be kept
separate and will not be used for any segment manipulations other
than during release. While releasing the segment if it cannot find
a driver to unload the segment, it searches the disabled driver
list. It tries to release the segment using a driver from this
list. This way there will be no database inconsistencies and the
same segmentation ID could be re-used when the type is re-enabled
later.

DocImpact: In 'http://docs.ocselected.org/openstack-manuals/kilo/\
networking-guide/content/ml2_scenarios.html' there is a Warning
message 'Disabling a ML2 type driver and re-enabling it later may
lead to database inconsistencies...'. Remove this warning from the
docs as the service now can properly delete the segments.

Change-Id: If08b304a9388058003d9f86f58295c6b5daef846
Closes-Bug: 1311470
'}]
commit_message:
Disabling/Re-enabling ML2 type driver create orphan n/w segments

Currently a warning is documented for ML2 type driver configuration
saying "Disabling a ML2 type driver and re-enabling it later may
lead to database inconsistencies if ML2 is reconfigured without
support for that type.". But there hasn't been any clear consensus
on what will be the correct fix for this. Some solutions have been
proposed that fixes the problem in a SQL query/script fix.

In this proposed solution, there are no foreign key based database
triggers/database scripts for the admin. Currently the segments are
released by the type driver loaded specific to that type. So this
change intends to use the type driver to release the segment.
Type manager loads all type drivers from the namespace. From this
list it then registers the enabled and disabled drivers using the
"type_drivers" config option. These disabled drivers will be kept
separate and will not be used for any segment manipulations other
than during release. While releasing the segment if it cannot find
a driver to unload the segment, it searches the disabled driver
list. It tries to release the segment using a driver from this
list. This way there will be no database inconsistencies and the
same segmentation ID could be re-used when the type is re-enabled
later.

DocImpact: In 'http://docs.ocselected.org/openstack-manuals/kilo/\
networking-guide/content/ml2_scenarios.html' there is a Warning
message 'Disabling a ML2 type driver and re-enabling it later may
lead to database inconsistencies...'. Remove this warning from the
docs as the service now can properly delete the segments.

Change-Id: If08b304a9388058003d9f86f58295c6b5daef846
Closes-Bug: 1311470

commit_message:
[WIP] Restore ebtables_driver/manager

The linuxbridge-dvr feature uses ebtables to manage DVR packet.
This patch reverts the patch[1].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/221364/

Change-Id: Iabced6ee64b7203ef21ceb8519bd6fa53acba565
Related-Bug: #1504039

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-22 18:18:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_common.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'etc/policy.json', 'neutron/tests/etc/policy.json'], 'message': 'Allow network owner get and delete all subnets

Current policy allow "admin_or_network_owner" to create subnet,
but only allow "admin_or_owner" to get network. This will stop
network owner to get a subnet created by admin.

This stops network owner to have total control to its network.
Such as, network owner cannot create port on its network,
cannot add this subnet onto a router as interface. And stops
network owner to delete its networks(when some subnets on its
network not owner by it) and those subnets not owned by it, even
policy allows:
  "delete_subnet": "rule:admin_or_network_owner"
  "delete_network": "rule:admin_or_owner"

Attention, this shouldn't be considered as a RBAC related issue.

This patch will fix this.

Closes-Bug: #1536176
Change-Id: I6a66bc039d86a844ab20294001a14bb69c166fea
'}]
commit_message:
Allow network owner get and delete all subnets

Current policy allow "admin_or_network_owner" to create subnet,
but only allow "admin_or_owner" to get network. This will stop
network owner to get a subnet created by admin.

This stops network owner to have total control to its network.
Such as, network owner cannot create port on its network,
cannot add this subnet onto a router as interface. And stops
network owner to delete its networks(when some subnets on its
network not owner by it) and those subnets not owned by it, even
policy allows:
  "delete_subnet": "rule:admin_or_network_owner"
  "delete_network": "rule:admin_or_owner"

Attention, this shouldn't be considered as a RBAC related issue.

This patch will fix this.

Closes-Bug: #1536176
Change-Id: I6a66bc039d86a844ab20294001a14bb69c166fea

messy info returned when an operation is not allowed by policy

Instead of simple message like "disallowed by policy", messy info
is returned when an operation is not allowed by the policy.

message with the in-complete router into, according to [4].

commit_message:
Don't register HA router to L3 agent when ha_port is not found

From the server side, router has a chance to be deleted during
the sync from L3 agent. If the deletion just happens before
[1], HA router that the L3 agent wants to sync will not include
HA_INTERFACE_KEY.
From the L3 agent side, if it is the first time that L3 agent
sync this HA router, there is a chance that the router is
registered to L3 agent's router_info before removal. Without
HA_INTERFACE_KEY, code will hit [2], and will register an in-
complete router into L3 agent's router_info. This makes following
action(removal) unable to finish, and will cause fullsync of
routers all the time.

The fix can be 2 directions, either one will work:
From the L3RouterPlugin, get HA_INTERFACE_KEY for HA router first.
Then get other router information and return to L3 agent. This
patch don't contain such change because it is a very rare case
and I am not sure if it will break other things.

From the L3NATAgent, don't register HA router to L3 agent when
ha_port is not found, and raise an exception to let [3] handle it.
As a result, L3 agent don't have to hanle the upcoming remove rpc
message with the in-complete router into, according to [4].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py#L546
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py#L82
[3] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/agent/l3/agent.py#L512-L515
[4] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/agent/l3/agent.py#L356

Change-Id: Iafdc4d68d4cb31d6699e87303d6e879f09d522d6
Closes-Bug: #1510757

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 06:17:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "add validate check for update_port

For LBaaS VIP port, its IP address is read only attribute, it
cannot be update to LBaaS API, but by neutron common command
'port-update', it could be. This should be invalid. Bug 1493688
is filed for this.

For router interface port, we can use 'port-update' to update
its device_id, which indeed will change the router_id this port
attaches to(even new device_id is not a router id). And we can
use 'router-port-list' to confirm. But this should be invalid,
for that will break data consistance between table Ports and
RouterPorts, record in the former one will have new device_id
while the later one will keep original device_id as router_id.
Bug 1408193 is filed for this.

This patch introduces a validate check method for update_port
to prevent two above cases happen.

Change-Id: I5f36fd216793e916fe8cd9ebe83ba5796a48f0a1
Closes-Bug: #1408193
Closes-Bug: #1493688
"}]
commit_message:
add validate check for update_port

For LBaaS VIP port, its IP address is read only attribute, it
cannot be update to LBaaS API, but by neutron common command
'port-update', it could be. This should be invalid. Bug 1493688
is filed for this.

For router interface port, we can use 'port-update' to update
its device_id, which indeed will change the router_id this port
attaches to(even new device_id is not a router id). And we can
use 'router-port-list' to confirm. But this should be invalid,
for that will break data consistance between table Ports and
RouterPorts, record in the former one will have new device_id
while the later one will keep original device_id as router_id.
Bug 1408193 is filed for this.

This patch introduces a validate check method for update_port
to prevent two above cases happen.

Change-Id: I5f36fd216793e916fe8cd9ebe83ba5796a48f0a1
Closes-Bug: #1408193
Closes-Bug: #1493688

commit_message:
Improve log level in neutron sanity check

For the sake of checking configuration against system available
features, some of the exception messages using debug level,
here we can replace them by warning level.

Change-Id: I450f894b60694ad20ac8e93ada80150a3231b57c

commit_message:
Debug patch to test the gate failures on SSHTimeOut

This is a debug patch to check the gate failures on SSHTimeOut.
The intent of this patch is to add some sort of self test with
in the agent to make sure that the path between the fip and
router namespace is connected and reachable.

Once we identify the gate failures with respect to FloatingIP
for DVR routers, this probe patch can be removed.

Change-Id: I1ed5c815fde66845f84d92382b6f07a9f443b393

commit_message:
Fix missing parent start() call in RpcWorker.

Patch 5be613490deebf494f2ecbbcd8cb5dd0d6f5e1b3 erroneously removed this
line that is still needed which broke networking-ovn, at least.

Change-Id: I31981e905f892df474c57b45d3e70ebfbeeae1db
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7b6fb800ced7c0b3f0be90d1c67d5ef58e58b82e)

Filter port-list based on security_groups associated

This fix enables to filter ports based on the security
groups assocaited with ports provided as input.

Patchset 2: Rebased

Change-Id: I9a70a3894237e01ea9bfac2e685fc480046ff5de
Closes-Bug: 1405057

commit_message:
Refactor _process_external_gateway in l3/router_info.py

The current logic in _process_external_gateway is a bit redundant
and hard to read. The refactor here is to clarify roles of ex_gw_port
vs self.ex_gw_port.

Change-Id: I2783d458b795ba392781503074d0abfef7223842

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-25 04:00:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/base_type_tunnel.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_tunnel.py'], 'message': 'skip add_endpoint for endpoint not changed case

In tunnel_type.py, in method tunnel_sync, endpoint will
be queried by passed host and ip, and previous checking
in tunnel_sync will check queried endpoint with passed
host and ip in multiple cases, like whether ip and host
have changed or upgraded.

But for case which ip and host are not changed will not
be checked(which will happen when ovs-agent or ovs
restarted) previous logic will call add_endpoint again for
passed ip and host, and raise warning like
"Endpoint with ip X already exists" in
neutron-server log.

It doesn't make sense, since ip and host are not changed,
and we have queried DB twice, we don't need do another DB
operation and raise a warning.

Closes-bug: #1494570

Change-Id: I7e1eb3fca10f69f3fe3740447dc4216144fc2268
'}]
commit_message:
skip add_endpoint for endpoint not changed case

In tunnel_type.py, in method tunnel_sync, endpoint will
be queried by passed host and ip, and previous checking
in tunnel_sync will check queried endpoint with passed
host and ip in multiple cases, like whether ip and host
have changed or upgraded.

But for case which ip and host are not changed will not
be checked(which will happen when ovs-agent or ovs
restarted) previous logic will call add_endpoint again for
passed ip and host, and raise warning like
"Endpoint with ip X already exists" in
neutron-server log.

It doesn't make sense, since ip and host are not changed,
and we have queried DB twice, we don't need do another DB
operation and raise a warning.

Closes-bug: #1494570

Change-Id: I7e1eb3fca10f69f3fe3740447dc4216144fc2268

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-30 14:15:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/external_process.py'], 'message': 'Check ProcessMonitor running flag before checking processes

We have a testing issue, where process monitor attempts to
respawn processes even if we ordered it to stop.

This is due to the loop design, and the checking interval,
if the stop flag is set during a long check interval, the
processes will still be checked once again.

In this new loop the flag is checked right before attempting
to start a checking thread.

Change-Id: Ifb3d3b1d317f9cc372f69e21ab98a6db9b3cba11
'}]
commit_message:
Check ProcessMonitor running flag before checking processes

We have a testing issue, where process monitor attempts to
respawn processes even if we ordered it to stop.

This is due to the loop design, and the checking interval,
if the stop flag is set during a long check interval, the
processes will still be checked once again.

In this new loop the flag is checked right before attempting
to start a checking thread.

Change-Id: Ifb3d3b1d317f9cc372f69e21ab98a6db9b3cba11

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-24 03:55:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/dvr_mac_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_dvr_mac_db.py'], 'message': "Remove duplicated logic in get_subnet_for_dvr

In get_subnet_for_dvr, subnet_id will be extracted from parameter
fixed_ips if fixed_ips is not None. But indeed, its callers has
already extracted subnet_id from fixed_ips before get_subnet_for_dvr
is called, like:

  def _bind_distributed_router_interface_port(..):
      fixed_ip = fixed_ips[0]
      subnet_uuid = fixed_ip['subnet_id']
      ...
      subnet_info = self.plugin_rpc.get_subnet_for_dvr(
          self.context, subnet_uuid, fixed_ips=fixed_ips)

So it's duplicated and unnecessary to extract again.

Closes-Bug: #1531065
Change-Id: Ieca37c96ec002e9277bc5bc86be48a843c5142a4
"}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicated logic in get_subnet_for_dvr

In get_subnet_for_dvr, subnet_id will be extracted from parameter
fixed_ips if fixed_ips is not None. But indeed, its callers has
already extracted subnet_id from fixed_ips before get_subnet_for_dvr
is called, like:

  def _bind_distributed_router_interface_port(..):
      fixed_ip = fixed_ips[0]
      subnet_uuid = fixed_ip['subnet_id']
      ...
      subnet_info = self.plugin_rpc.get_subnet_for_dvr(
          self.context, subnet_uuid, fixed_ips=fixed_ips)

So it's duplicated and unnecessary to extract again.

Closes-Bug: #1531065
Change-Id: Ieca37c96ec002e9277bc5bc86be48a843c5142a4

commit_message:
Fix help text for option min_l3_agents_per_router

The current help text incorrectly states that this option might be
set to 0, but looking at the code, that will indeed lead to an
error. Probably the text was wrongly copied from
max_l3_agents_per_router.

Change-Id: I999c21ec1170b09f0ffa18ec181ead19c15ee7a2

commit_message:
Fix neutron bug 1525059
Add a new options "--provider:underlay_flooding_list" to net-create,
This option will be used to add VTEP whic is out of neutron to a VXLAN network.

Change-Id: Idfd116034b5237b35fb6f41c1a03f418a6c5f392
Partial-Bug: #1525059

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-22 13:20:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py'], 'message': "optimize _update_arp_entry for internal subnets

Upstream methods like _process_arp_cache_for_internal_port
and _set_subnet_arp_info will call _update_arp_entry to
update arp entry for arp_entry/ports in subnet.

_update_arp_entry use subnet_id to create interface device
object and check device existence, it's not always so necessary.
_process_arp_cache_for_internal_port and _set_subnet_arp_info
can send device existence to _update_arp_entry to prevent
repeatedly calls to IPDevice.exists(), which will cost unnecessary
shell calls.

Closes-bug: #1514068
Change-Id: I840775070475df0242c4c50119b93875fd1da1fd
"}]
commit_message:
optimize _update_arp_entry for internal subnets

Upstream methods like _process_arp_cache_for_internal_port
and _set_subnet_arp_info will call _update_arp_entry to
update arp entry for arp_entry/ports in subnet.

_update_arp_entry use subnet_id to create interface device
object and check device existence, it's not always so necessary.
_process_arp_cache_for_internal_port and _set_subnet_arp_info
can send device existence to _update_arp_entry to prevent
repeatedly calls to IPDevice.exists(), which will cost unnecessary
shell calls.

Closes-bug: #1514068
Change-Id: I840775070475df0242c4c50119b93875fd1da1fd

commit_message:
Add tag mechanism for resources other than network

Introduce a generic mechanism to allow the user to set tags
on Neutron resources.

APIImpact
DocImpact: allow users to set tags on resources other than network

Change-Id: I627fb9163d1fc43aa16b659f823d91537e312c28
Implements: blueprint add-tags-to-core-resources
Related-Bug: #1489291

commit_message:
Add reserved stamps to notify flows created by other than ovs agent.

Flows without a stamp shoud not be deleted by ovs agent.
This patch modifies not to delete flows created by other than ovs
agent.

Change-Id: Iab3dd8e48fd2f707c1253832c5f4394a3169163a
Closes-Bug: #1525775

commit_message:
port: add --no-fixed-ip option to allow port without subnet/ip address

Now Neutron could create a port without the IP address when the network
doesn't have a subnet. Allow neutronclient to make such subnet/port.

Partially Implements: blueprint vm-without-l3-address

Change-Id: I4218669fabd342fba483e18af1e5e4ff4090b009

commit_message:
Increase default num_sync_threads of dhcp sync

Add recommendation and suggestion for higher performance.
Twice times faster when it increase to 16 with 1500+ networks

Change-Id: I7c1ba31fb1146be682819558f47a4837c5a7f0ea
Related-Bug: 1534587

commit_message:
Verify attributes inside a dict in request body

Currently if a dict in request body that has some wrong
attributes, No error will shown.
This patch called verify_attributes() in _validate_dict(), so that
attributes inside a dict will also be verified.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Ia859ae015642a3f8cfd8c54afe2450fa82aaef43
Closes-Bug: #1535626

commit_message:
Fix for adding gateway with IP outside subnet

Currently 'force_gateway_on_subnet' configuration is set to True
by default and enforces the subnet on to the gateway. With this
fix 'force_gateway_on_subnet' can be changed to False, and
gateway outside the subnet can be added.
Before adding the default route, a route to the gateway IP is
added. This applies to both external and internal networks.

Change-Id: I3a942cf98d263681802729cf09527f06c80fab2b
Closes-Bug: #1335023
Closes-Bug: #1398768
(cherry picked from commit b6126bc0f17f348ff6303b9bd6041cb018479ef9)
(cherry picked from commit 9e11c5b8516c42000d5409c0f44f852acb5fed3d)

subject: PEP257: add flake8-docstring testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 01:42:39.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'PEP257: add flake8-docstring testing

PEP257 (https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0257/) aims to "standardize
the high-level structure of docstrings: what they should contain, and
how to say it (without touching on any markup syntax within docstrings).
The PEP contains conventions, not laws or syntax."

By having this flake8 extension installed as we do in other keystone
repositories, keystonemiddleware will be automatically gated against
PEP257 docstring conventions. Of course, we're also violating several
conventions here, all of which must be ignored to get the pep8 tox job
passing.

By fixing violations one at a time, we can then remove the ignore lines
in subsequent patches.

Change-Id: Icb329b7fb42172245a635d7c089858d66a6a19da
'}]
commit_message:
PEP257: add flake8-docstring testing

PEP257 (https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0257/) aims to "standardize
the high-level structure of docstrings: what they should contain, and
how to say it (without touching on any markup syntax within docstrings).
The PEP contains conventions, not laws or syntax."

By having this flake8 extension installed as we do in other keystone
repositories, keystonemiddleware will be automatically gated against
PEP257 docstring conventions. Of course, we're also violating several
conventions here, all of which must be ignored to get the pep8 tox job
passing.

By fixing violations one at a time, we can then remove the ignore lines
in subsequent patches.

Change-Id: Icb329b7fb42172245a635d7c089858d66a6a19da

magnum::db::sync currently tries to use a pre-liberty command to

subject: Generate ceph client key
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 13:19:56.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Generate ceph client key

By default only the admin user key is generated and this key is used
for both admin and openstack user.
Because the mode of the client's key file is 644, any user with a
valid shell on the controller/compute/ceph nodes can made admin
operations on the ceph cluster.
This patch allows to generate a random key for the openstack user that
will be used by tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: I404665c09084f0a6cd2d8872940ee90220dc5f69
(cherry picked from commit adccde0cd572b5c4f2cc25d764afdcb9e1df5163)
